bcl:text.in:doc:
An Act Relating to the Island Railway, the
            Graving Dock, and Railway Lands of the Province
bcl:text.#text:
means the lands on Vancouver Island granted to
          the Dominion Government by section 3 of , S.B.C. 1884, c. 14, and
          includes the lands referred to in sections 4 and 6 of that Act.

In this section,  means every disposition or
          purported disposition of any interest in petroleum or natural gas or both in the railway
          lands made, before June 17, 1986, by the government under the  or any enactment replaced by that Act.

bcl:text:
Every disposition is confirmed and ratified, and for this purpose it is declared
          that every interest in petroleum and natural gas that

was, immediately before that disposition, transferred to, vested in and reserved
          to the government.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: existed in the railway lands affected by the disposition, and
was not, at the time of the disposition, vested in the government

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
This section is retroactive to the extent necessary to give it full
          effect.

Nothing in this section operates to revive or reinstate an interest that a person
          had under a disposition if that interest was subsequently abandoned, forfeited or
          surrendered to the government or otherwise extinguished.

The Lieutenant Governor in Council may order that all interests in petroleum and
          natural gas in any part of the railway lands is confirmed in or transferred to, and is
          vested in and reserved to, the government if

bcl:text.#text:
before June 17, 1986, the petroleum and natural gas in that part of those lands
            has not been the subject of a disposition or purported disposition of petroleum or
            natural gas or both under the , and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
the Lieutenant Governor in Council considers that in order to facilitate
            exploration for or extraction of petroleum or natural gas or both, it is desirable to
            make an order under this section.

must describe that part of the railway lands in respect of which it applies,
            with sufficient particularity to identify the lands, and

is, despite any other enactment, but subject to subsections (3) and (4),
            effective without further conveyance or transfer, to transfer to and vest in the
            government all those interests in petroleum and natural gas in the lands so described as
            are not already vested in the government.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If an order is made under subsection (1), the minister

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
must publish a copy of the order or a summary of its contents in a newspaper
            circulating in the area of the land affected, and

may post or erect, on or in the vicinity of the affected land, a sign containing
            a copy of the order or a summary of its contents.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
The transfer and vesting referred to in subsection (2) (b) takes effect 30
          days after the copy or summary referred to in subsection (3) is first published as
          required by that subsection.

A person who establishes, in accordance with this Act, that, immediately before a
          transfer to and vesting in the government of petroleum and natural gas under section 2 or
          under an order under section 3, the person had an interest in that petroleum and natural
          gas is, subject to this Act, entitled to compensation from the government.

A person is not entitled to compensation in respect of an interest that the person
          had in petroleum and natural gas unless the person files in the prescribed manner
          particulars of the person's claim with the board,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
in the case of a transfer and vesting effected by section 2, within one year
            after June 17, 1986, or

in the case of a transfer and vesting occurring under an order under section 3,
            within one year after the transfer and vesting takes effect.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A right to compensation under this section is personal property.

Compensation in respect of a person's interest in petroleum and natural gas must
          not exceed the lesser of

bcl:text.#text:
if the petroleum and natural gas is the subject of a petroleum and natural gas
            lease under the , the
            royalty reserved to the government under that Act, or

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
an amount equivalent to the royalty that the board considers would have been
            paid to the owner.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
The board must determine whether persons who have filed particulars of their claim
          in accordance with section 4 have established their claim and the amount of compensation
          payable to them.

bcl:text.#text:
For the purpose of this section, Part 17 of the  applies, with any additions and modifications the
          Lieutenant Governor in Council prescribes.

If by the operation of this Act an interest in petroleum and natural gas in railway
        lands is or becomes vested in the government, that interest is deemed, for the purposes of
        the application of section
          23 (2) (a) of the , to be held by the
        government under a subsisting exception and reservation contained in the original grant of
        those lands from the government.
